title: Redundant SSZ generic tests
body:
Thank @winsvega for reporting it.

### Issue
For example, the tests [uint_128_max_0](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tree/master/tests/general/phase0/ssz_generic/uints/valid/uint_128_max_0) - [uint_128_max_4](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-spec-tests/tree/master/tests/general/phase0/ssz_generic/uints/valid/uint_128_max_4) are redundant because [`variation`](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/1235e58a8db09efd058f31087d53d91b97b83011/tests/generators/ssz_generic/ssz_uints.py#L24-L25) doesn't make difference in non-random tests.

It also applies to other SSZ types:

> Its not just with uint. Other folders also have similar same tests. Looks like a bug in test generator script. 
> Also the containers. Ssz requires a structure. There it goes input {a, b, c, d, e}
> But it actually is { [a,b], c, d, e} or similar. And the container also has redundant tests

### How to fix it?

Go thought the [`get_random_ssz_object`](https://github.com/ethereum/consensus-specs/blob/4f905551c077f65250cced92688b7c6abf0c0168/tests/core/pyspec/eth2spec/debug/random_value.py#L38) helper and check if `variation` was wrongly used in non-random tests.
